intro: Megacarpaea delavayi var. minor, commonly known as the small-fruited megacarpaea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule containing several seeds. This variety is native to the mountainous regions of southwest China, where it thrives in cool, moist environments.
